channel.title: bmap.txt format on bmap-to-json documentation
channel.description: Recent content in bmap.txt format on bmap-to-json documentation

item.description: You can find your maps at: On Windows: %localappdata%/BoringManRewrite/maps/ On Linux: ~/.config/BoringManRewrite/maps/

item.title: Glossary
item.description: MD5 Checksum Parallax MD5 Checksum MD5, or Message Digest Algorithm 5, is a cryptographic hash function designed to produce a fixed-size, 128-bit hash value from any input data. MD5 is commonly used for checksums and data integrity verification. Its primary function is to generate a unique hash for a given set of data, creating a digital “fingerprint” that is ideally unique to each distinct input.
